translation: Let Sri Bhagauti Ji (the Primal Lord) be helpful.

gurmukhi: ਲੲੀ ਛੀਨ ਛੳੁਨੀ ਕਰੇ ਬਿੱਪ ਭੂਪੰ ॥ ਹਰੀ ਫੇਰ ਛੱਤ੍ਰਿਨ ਦਿਜੰ ਜੀਤ ਜੂਪੰ ॥
transliteration: Laichheen Chhaounidare Bipp Bhoopan|| Haripher Chhattrin Dijan Jeet Joopan||
translation: After seizing the capital, Parashurama made a Brahmin the king, but again the Kshatriyas, conquering all the Brahmins, snatched their city.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਜੰ ਅਾਰਤੰ ਤੀਰ ਰਾਮੰ ਪੁਕਾਰੰ ॥ ਚਲਿਯੋ ਰੋਸ ਸੀ ਰਾਮ ਲੀਨੇ ਕੁਠਾਰੰ ॥੩੧॥
transliteration: Dijan Aaratan Teer Raamannd Poukaaran|| Chaliyo Ros Siraam Leene Kouthaaran||31||
translation: The Brahmin, in great agony called Parashurama, who, holding his axe, moved with great fury.31.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਯੋ ਸਰਬ ਭੂਪੰ ਹਠੀ ਰਾਮ ਅਾੲੇ ॥ ਸਭੰ ਜੁੱਧੁ ਕੋ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਬਨਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Sounyo Sarab Bhoopan Ha6thiraam Aae|| Sabhan Juddh(u) Ko Sastra Astran Banaae||
translation: When all the kings heard that taking a vow of killing Kshatriyas, the persistent Parashurama had arrived, then all of them prepared for war, taking all their weapons.

gurmukhi: ਚੜੈ ਚੳੁਪ ਕੈਕੈ ਕੀੲੇ ਜੁੱਧੁ ਅੈਸੇ ॥ ਮਨੋ ਰਾਮ ਸੋ ਰਾਵਣੰ ਲੰਕ ਜੈਸੇ ॥੩੨॥
transliteration: Chadai Chaoup Kai-kai Keee Juddh(u) Aise|| Mano Raam So Raavanan Lank Jaise||32||
translation: In great ire, all of them came to wage the war like Rana and Ravana in Sri Lanka.32.

gurmukhi: ਲਗੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਲਖੇ ਰਾਮ ਅੰਗੰ ॥ ਗਹੇ ਬਾਣ ਪਾਣੰ ਕੀੲੇ ਸਤ੍ਰੁ ਭੰਗੰ ॥
transliteration: Lage Sastra Astran Lakhe Raam Anadg|| Gade Baan Paanan Keee Satru Bhanadg||
translation: When Parashurama saw that he was being attacked with arms and weapons, then he took the arrows in hand and killed his enemies;

gurmukhi: ਭੁਜਾਹੀਣ ੲੇਕੰ ਸਿਰੰ ਹੀਣ ਕੇਤੇ ॥ ਸਭੈ ਮਾਰ ਡਾਰੇ ਗੲੇ ਬੀਰ ਜੇਤੇ ॥੩੩॥
transliteration: Bhujaaheen Ekan Siran Heen Kete|| Sabhai Maar Ddare Gad Beer Jete||33||
translation: Many warriors became armless and many became headless. All those warriors who went in front of Parashurama, he killed all of the,.33.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੀ ਛੱਤ੍ਹੀਣੰ ਛਿਤੰ ਕੀਸ ਬਾਰੰ ॥ ਹਣੇ ਅੈਸ ਹੀ ਭੂਪ ਸਰਬੰ ਸੁਧਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Karichhattra-heenan Chhigadg Kees Baaran|| Hane Ais Hibhoop Saraban Sdhaaran||
translation: He caused the earth to become without Kshatriyas for twenty-one times and in this way, he destroyed all the kings and their base;

gurmukhi: ਕਥਾ ਸਰਬ ਜੳੁ ਛੋਰ ਤੇ ਲੈ ਸੁਨਾੳੂਂ ॥ ਹ੍ਰਿਦੈ ਗ੍ਰੰਥ ਕੇ ਬਾਢਬੇ ਤੇ ਡਰਾੳੂਂ ॥੩੪॥
transliteration: Kath3 Sarab Jau Chhodh Te Lai Sounaaoon|| Hridai Granth Ke Baadhhe Te Daraaoon||34||
translation: And if I describe the complete story from one end to the other, then I fear that the book will become very voluminous.34.
